title: Passenger killed when gunman hijacks city bus, leads police on chase through downtown Los Angeles
content: In Los Angeles, a gunman hijacked a city bus, leading to a slow police chase that ended with the suspect's arrest. One passenger was killed, while the driver and another passenger were treated at the scene. Authorities are looking into ways to enhance safety on public transportation systems.
summary: In Los Angeles, a gunman hijacked a city bus, leading to a slow police chase that ended with the suspect's arrest. One passenger was killed, while the driver and another passenger were treated at the scene. Authorities are looking into ways to enhance safety on public transportation systems.

title: Putin issues nuclear warnings to the West over strikes from Ukraine
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin updated the country's nuclear doctrine, warning that any conventional attack on Russia by a non-nuclear state, if backed by a nuclear power, will be seen as a joint attack. Ukrainian officials called this nuclear blackmail. The Biden administration has not authorized Kyiv to strike inside Russia.
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin updated the country's nuclear doctrine, warning that any conventional attack on Russia by a non-nuclear state, if backed by a nuclear power, will be seen as a joint attack. Ukrainian officials called this nuclear blackmail. The Biden administration has not authorized Kyiv to strike inside Russia.

title: Hurricane Helene prompts mass evacuations in Florida as it nears landfall
content: Hurricane Helene intensifies as it nears Florida, causing destruction in Mexico and leading to evacuations across the Southeast. President Joe Biden declares a state of emergency in Florida. The storm is projected to maintain its strength with winds over 110 mph, expected to make landfall in Florida's Big Bend region.
summary: Hurricane Helene intensifies as it nears Florida, causing destruction in Mexico and leading to evacuations across the Southeast. President Joe Biden declares a state of emergency in Florida. The storm is projected to maintain its strength with winds over 110 mph, expected to make landfall in Florida's Big Bend region.

title: 'He took a bullet for democracy': Trump to hold rally at site of assassination attempt
content: Donald Trump is set to hold a rally on October 5 in Butler, Pennsylvania, revisiting the site of a July assassination attempt. The event will honor Corey Comperatore, who died shielding his family during the attack. Trump will also recognize other victims and express gratitude to law enforcement and first responders.
summary: Donald Trump is set to hold a rally on October 5 in Butler, Pennsylvania, revisiting the site of a July assassination attempt. The event will honor Corey Comperatore, who died shielding his family during the attack. Trump will also recognize other victims and express gratitude to law enforcement and first responders.

title: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau survives no-confidence vote amid conservative pressure
content: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau narrowly survived a no-confidence vote with 211 lawmakers opposing and 120 in favour. Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre introduced the motion, criticising Trudeau's handling of high living costs and rising crime rates. The Liberals face increased vulnerability after the NDP withdrew from their coalition agreement, leading to heightened political tension.
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau narrowly survived a no-confidence vote with 211 lawmakers opposing and 120 in favour. Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre introduced the motion, criticising Trudeau's handling of high living costs and rising crime rates. The Liberals face increased vulnerability after the NDP withdrew from their coalition agreement, leading to heightened political tension.

title: Why are christians calling for a boycott of Coca-Cola over 'Jesus' custom cans?
content: A video showing a Coca-Cola machine declining to print 'Jesus' on a custom soda can has incited outrage among some Christian consumers, prompting boycott calls. Antwoine Hill's Facebook post revealed that other religious names were accepted. Coca-Cola explained that phrases might be rejected due to trademark or potential offensiveness.
summary: A video showing a Coca-Cola machine declining to print 'Jesus' on a custom soda can has incited outrage among some Christian consumers, prompting boycott calls. Antwoine Hill's Facebook post revealed that other religious names were accepted. Coca-Cola explained that phrases might be rejected due to trademark or potential offensiveness.

title: Kamala Harris leads Donald Trump by narrow margin in key battleground state: Survey
content: Kamala Harris edges out Donald Trump in a recent Monmouth University poll conducted in Pennsylvania. Harris secures 40 percent definite support while Trump has 38 percent. Voters identify inflation as their primary concern, followed by economic growth, abortion, and immigration. The survey sampled 654 voters with a margin of error of plus or minus 4.5 percentage points.
summary: Kamala Harris edges out Donald Trump in a recent Monmouth University poll conducted in Pennsylvania. Harris secures 40 percent definite support while Trump has 38 percent. Voters identify inflation as their primary concern, followed by economic growth, abortion, and immigration. The survey sampled 654 voters with a margin of error of plus or minus 4.5 percentage points.

title: Two Injured in 'intentionally set' explosive device blast at California courthouse
US woman ends life using 'suicide pod': What is it, how does it work?
'She will protect...': Jennifer Lawrence backs Kamala Harris for US presidential polls
content: Jennifer Lawrence has officially endorsed Kamala Harris and Tim Walz for the 2024 US presidential election, citing Harris's dedication to protecting women's rights post-Roe v Wade. The actress is also producing documentaries on women’s issues and abortion rights. Celebrities like Taylor Swift and Billie Eilish have similarly endorsed the Democratic candidates.
summary: Jennifer Lawrence has officially endorsed Kamala Harris and Tim Walz for the 2024 US presidential election, citing Harris's dedication to protecting women's rights post-Roe v Wade. The actress is also producing documentaries on women’s issues and abortion rights. Celebrities like Taylor Swift and Billie Eilish have similarly endorsed the Democratic candidates.

title: Kamala Harris falls short of Biden’s 2020 polling numbers: CNN poll
content: Political strategist Scott Jennings has expressed concerns over Kamala Harris's polling numbers. A CNN poll shows her leading Trump among voters under 35 but struggling with key demographics like young voters and working-class individuals. This raises questions about the Democratic Party’s prospects in the upcoming elections, emphasising the importance of engaging young voters.
summary: Political strategist Scott Jennings has expressed concerns over Kamala Harris's polling numbers. A CNN poll shows her leading Trump among voters under 35 but struggling with key demographics like young voters and working-class individuals. This raises questions about the Democratic Party’s prospects in the upcoming elections, emphasising the importance of engaging young voters.

title: California governor signs bills to bolster gun control
content: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed several new gun control laws aimed at expanding restrictions on firearm ownership. These include provisions against individuals involved in stalking, animal cruelty, and domestic violence. The legislation also targets ghost guns and aims to enhance protections for domestic violence survivors. Newsom stressed California's proactive approach amid a lack of federal action.
summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed several new gun control laws aimed at expanding restrictions on firearm ownership. These include provisions against individuals involved in stalking, animal cruelty, and domestic violence. The legislation also targets ghost guns and aims to enhance protections for domestic violence survivors. Newsom stressed California's proactive approach amid a lack of federal action.

title: 'We really need to do it': JPMorgan CEO backs Elon Musk’s ‘very good idea’
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon endorses Elon Musk's proposal for a government efficiency commission, emphasizing the need for accountability and efficient public spending at the India Investor Summit. Former President Donald Trump also supports the idea, pledging to appoint Musk if re-elected. The commission aims to audit federal operations and recommend reforms to eliminate fraud.
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon endorses Elon Musk's proposal for a government efficiency commission, emphasizing the need for accountability and efficient public spending at the India Investor Summit. Former President Donald Trump also supports the idea, pledging to appoint Musk if re-elected. The commission aims to audit federal operations and recommend reforms to eliminate fraud.

title: 'You will not boost your power at Ukraine's expense': Zelenskyy takes aim at China, Brazil
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the UN General Assembly, questioning China and Brazil's true interest in proposing peace talks with Russia. He criticized temporary truce plans and asserted that Ukraine would reject any externally imposed agreements. Zelenskyy cautioned that alternative peace efforts would only prolong the conflict instead of achieving genuine resolution.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the UN General Assembly, questioning China and Brazil's true interest in proposing peace talks with Russia. He criticized temporary truce plans and asserted that Ukraine would reject any externally imposed agreements. Zelenskyy cautioned that alternative peace efforts would only prolong the conflict instead of achieving genuine resolution.

title: US revokes Georgian PM's Invitation to Biden's UN reception amid strained ties
content: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze's invitation to a reception hosted by US President Joe Biden during the UNGA was revoked due to alleged anti-democratic actions and negative rhetoric towards the US. This development underscores strained relations between Georgia and Western powers, amid accusations of authoritarianism and pro-Russian policies from the ruling Georgian Dream party.
summary: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze's invitation to a reception hosted by US President Joe Biden during the UNGA was revoked due to alleged anti-democratic actions and negative rhetoric towards the US. This development underscores strained relations between Georgia and Western powers, amid accusations of authoritarianism and pro-Russian policies from the ruling Georgian Dream party.

title: Man hijacks bus in Los Angeles, 1 passenger killed
content: Early Wednesday in downtown Los Angeles, a man hijacked a Metro bus, holding the driver at gunpoint and fatally shooting a passenger. Police pursued the bus for an hour before arresting the suspect and finally later the driver and another passenger were rescued without injuries. Police said that the investigation remains ongoing.
summary: Early Wednesday in downtown Los Angeles, a man hijacked a Metro bus, holding the driver at gunpoint and fatally shooting a passenger. Police pursued the bus for an hour before arresting the suspect and finally later the driver and another passenger were rescued without injuries. Police said that the investigation remains ongoing.

title: Israeli NGO Shavei Israel appeals for immigration of deceased Indian-origin soldier Geri Gideon Hanghal's family
content: Shavei Israel, an Israeli NGO, is calling for support to help the family of Indian-origin Staff Sergeant Geri Gideon Hanghal immigrate to Israel after he was killed in a vehicle-ramming attack. The organization emphasizes aiding Bnei Menashe community members still in India who wish to make aliyah.
summary: Shavei Israel, an Israeli NGO, is calling for support to help the family of Indian-origin Staff Sergeant Geri Gideon Hanghal immigrate to Israel after he was killed in a vehicle-ramming attack. The organization emphasizes aiding Bnei Menashe community members still in India who wish to make aliyah.

title: Sri Lanka's parliamentary election will cost approx Rs 3 billion, more expensive than presidential poll
content: Anura Kumara Dissanayake's recent victory has led to an early parliamentary election in Sri Lanka, costing 11 billion Sri Lankan rupees which is up from 10 billion rupees from presidential polls. Dissolving Parliament 11 months ahead of schedule, Dissanayake diverges from former president Ranil Wickremesinghe's plans to delay elections due to economic constraints and prioritize financial recovery.
summary: Anura Kumara Dissanayake's recent victory has led to an early parliamentary election in Sri Lanka, costing 11 billion Sri Lankan rupees which is  up from 10 billion rupees from presidential polls. Dissolving Parliament 11 months ahead of schedule, Dissanayake diverges from former president Ranil Wickremesinghe's plans to delay elections due to economic constraints and prioritize financial recovery.

title: Philippines military backs permanent stay of US missile system
content: Philippine military chief General Romeo Brawner supports the permanent presence of a US missile system in his country, despite China's objections. The Typhon mid-range missile system was deployed during joint exercises and has not been removed. Defence Secretary Gilberto Teodoro criticized China for interfering and urged Beijing to dismantle its own military assets.
summary: Philippine military chief General Romeo Brawner supports the permanent presence of a US missile system in his country, despite China's objections. The Typhon mid-range missile system was deployed during joint exercises and has not been removed. Defence Secretary Gilberto Teodoro criticized China for interfering and urged Beijing to dismantle its own military assets.

title: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau faces no-confidence vote in Liberal-minority government
content: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's main rival in Canada's parliament on Tuesday introduced a motion of no confidence in the ruling Liberals, in a first major test of his unpopular minority government. In Canada's Westminster parliamentary system, a ruling party must hold the confidence of the House of Commons, which means maintaining support from a majority of members.
summary: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's main rival in Canada's parliament on Tuesday introduced a motion of no confidence in the ruling Liberals, in a first major test of his unpopular minority government. In Canada's Westminster parliamentary system, a ruling party must hold the confidence of the House of Commons, which means maintaining support from a majority of members.
